name: London International Exhibition of 1851
obverse: Bust of Prince Albert facing right.
reverse: A view of the exhibition building.
reverse_inscriptions: THE BUILDING FOR THE GREAT EXHIBITION IN LONDON 1851

PROPOSED BY H.R.H. PRINCE ALBERT. DESIGNED BY JOSEPH PAXTON ESQ. F.L.S. ERECTED BY FOX, HENDERSON, & CO. LENGTH 1848 FEET, WIDTH 456 FEET, HEIGHT OF PRINCIPAL ROOF 66 FEET, HEIGHT OF TRANSEPT 108 FEET, GLAZED SURFACE 900,000 FEET, OCCUPIES 18 ACRES OF GROUND
description: The exhibition occurred in London in 1851.
